climatePledgeFriendly.details: OEKO-TEX STANDARD 100 requires textiles-based products to be tested against a list of 1,000+ chemicals, to limit those which may be harmful to human health. Certification focus: #ProductSafety and #ChemicalsUsed.

features: 【What You Can Get】-3 Pieces Linen Duvet Cover Sets include: 1 duvet cover and 2 pillow shams. Queen Size duvet cover (88"x92"), 2 pillow shams size (20" x 26"). Note: This product does not include the comforter.Note:Every set includes 2 spare buttons.

【Material】-100% Pure Linen with Stone Washed. Linen Fabric will get softer with each wash, it is breathable, not easy to fade. The looser weave creates warmth without trapping moisture.The linen bedding set will keep you warm on chilly nights and cool on warm nights, stay comfortable the whole night. An "investment piece" for your bedroom. OEKO-TEX STANDARD 100 CERTIFIED.

【Product Detail】-Our Linen duvet cover has 4 corner ties inside, secure your comforter or duvet in right place to ensure tight sleep. The closure type is button, the fasteners are hidden for a seamless look，which is pretty and classic.
【Use Instruction】-Wash under 60℃;Warm Iron; Tumble dry with medium heat ;Wash with similar colors; Wash dark color separately.Please close the button when washing to avoid tearing.

【Design&Gift】-The linen product uses a solid color design, looks natural and concise, suitable for different styles of bedroom use.8 colors for you to choose, you can choose your favorite color according to your furniture, decoration style and even mood. The linen bedding set is also a great gift for your friends and family.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very impressed - and I’m not new to linen!
reviews.reviewText: I bought two Full Size Duvets for my 6yr-old and 2yr-old. We currently have all linen bedding for our bed and our guest bed, so when we bought our girls new beds, I knew I wanted to get them each a white linen duvet plus a down comforter insert.The down comforter inserts that I found are awesome! It’s a Canadian brand that I ordered through Amazon and the price was excellent. The only thing is, the double/full size of the down comforter was not a very common size, which meant trouble with finding a duvet cover. I loved it for our kids bed because it didn’t have too much overhang on the sizes - therefore it wasn’t too heavy for them to move around in. So I went searching and found that this product was the ONLY duvet that had the size that matched up with our insert. Although there were some concerning reviews, this is my full assessment after receiving it:-First if all, if you’re getting a full size (or really ANY SIZE for that matter), please LOOK AT THE MEASUREMENTS. I’m pretty sure a lot of these negative reviews regarding the full-size not being the correct size would actually be wiped from existence if the people would’ve actually looked at the size of their insert and the size of the duvet cover. In my case, this was the exact size I needed. My insert was the exact same size as this linen cover and they fit perfectly together. It IS a more uncommon size compared to most others, so just pay attention to sizing and you’ll be fine.- In regards to all the reviews calling it “scratchy” linen, my first question would be if they’ve ever owned anything linen that touches their skin? Any linen Clothes? Bedding? Blankets? If you have and you know what linen is, what linen feels like, and you enjoy the benefits of it being more breathable when it’s hot, yet warm when it’s cold, then I do believe you’re going to be very happy with this product. I’m wondering if all these people calling it “scratchy” are only familiar with the super smooth feeling of polyester or a soft cotton-blend sheet. This is linen, and linen isn’t a silky feel. I can fully understand that it’s not for everyone, but I personally sleep in linen sheets and will never go back. It’s also on my guest bed and I’ve even received compliments from previous skeptics.-Next, this is a very affordable option! Anyone who has searched for linen bedding knows it’s pretty pricey. I spent $900+ from Bed Threads for sheets & duvets with our King bed and our Queen guest bed. With that said, these honestly felt very, very similar right out of the box to my Bed Threads linen and after the first wash. After washing them each with 1/2 cup baking soda, they felt just fine and honestly no different than my Bed Threads set. I hate saying that because I spent so much more on my BT sets, but they look and feel basically identical.-wrinkles? Ha - yes. It’s linen! It has a very natural look and does not look pressed. With that said, the wrinkles are no different than my bed threads linen so I don’t think this is anything against this product. Linen will have wrinkled/rippled look.-In my situation, where I was buying this for my two young kids, I honestly wanted a cheaper option than Bed Threads BUT still wanted linen. I also definitely didn’t want another 2-3 month wait again for shipping from Australia. It was worth it at the time, but man I don’t want to do that again right now. I just want to get something I liked on my kids new down comforters - asap.-My only hesitation is possibly the stitching and how well that’ll hold up, but only time will tell for that. It all seems to be just fine as of right now and each set washed nicely without any issue.-I’m also watching out for this “fuzzy” frenzy that I read about from a few others. Some people mentioned lint everywhere, everyday. Vacuuming up insane amounts.. I believe people all have different experiences, BUT there wasn’t even any crazy amount of lint that came from the dryer’s lint catcher. I had about 5x more lint come from one Turkish towel than both duvets combined. Also, I wear all black about 95% of the time. I always know how bad something will shed because if it touches my leggings it’ll leave a full blown layer of lint if it has a shedding issue. I didn’t the test after taking the sets out of the dryer.. no lint rubbed off on my black leggings. I’d honestly be extremely surprised if random lint started flying out everywhere when I’m not seeing anything at all, but if it does I’ll definitely update.This seems like an excellent option at a very affordable price. I also love the pillow case covers! They’re very pretty and have such a nice relaxed look around the edges, and a standard pillow fills them great. I honestly like them better than my bed threads Euro Shams!Basically, if you want to spend tons of money from another company, I can’t say I blame you. I’ve done it and it was exciting! BUT I’m here to say you definitely don’t HAVE to, especially if you’re trying to stay on a budget or just don’t want to. After getting these, I’d say to trust the positive reviews on here. I’m sure there are these one-off issues that can happen with manufacturing, but if you’re worried about quality I honestly think the quality is on par with the more expensive linens from other companies.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So cozy yet breathable!
reviews.reviewText: Recently made the switch to linen because my fiancé and I are both very hot sleepers but still like the comfort of a duvet. I originally purchased the dark grey color and it’s a nice blue/grey tone. Our puppy chewed it. So I re-ordered and this time decided to go with the Linen color and it’s the perfect neutral tone that could be paired with browns or greys. Linen feels a little scratchy at first but softens up the more you wash it. I’ve washed this twice so far and it’s already become softer and is holding up nicely. Linen is naturally “wrinkly” looking so if you don’t like that textured look you won’t be super satisfied with the look of this duvet cover.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super comfy and cozy
reviews.reviewText: This duvet is so comfy! It’s very breathable and gets softer with every wash. I have sheets that match as well. I live in a tropical climate and needed to change to a cooler duvet cover. I use this with a down comforter and it’s perfect. The only thing I don’t really like about it is the button closures. You have to undo and redo like 20 buttons to insert the duvet, which takes a pretty long time. It does come with a couple extra buttons just in case they come off. But the look of the buttons is cute. It is definitely not wrinkle free, but I think it adds to the rustic look.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Pretty but needs improvement
reviews.reviewText: This linen is beautiful! I love the white trim along the edges. It is also soft, though not as soft as linen can be. It is also not thin but not super thick.Given that it is linen... there are things to be mindful of. First, linen is low maintenance... meaning, you don't need to use a lot of water/electricity to launder. So, use low dry heat and cold water. I usually take it out of the dryer midway... I just need it damp as linen dries quite fast. Linen also tends to be wrinkly after washing so keep that in mind if you're someone who expects perfection. As I get older, I tend to appreciate this value of wrinkles in linen and with usage, the wrinkles disappear. So the negatives... the case seems to be bigger than needed. This is perhaps to allocate shrinkage. I also think this can be improved by adding a button or zipper on the enclosure or do an envelope style enclosure. As this is bigger... it leaves a gap opening in the back, especially after washing when it tends to be wrinkly. Kinda beats the purpose of having a case. I am still keeping the cases as they are affordable, pretty, since this size is extremely hard to find for linen cases, and it is linen. But, I would consider switching for a case with secured back enclosure if one is available.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars There's a reason I have this on all my beds!
reviews.reviewText: Okay we all know linen bedding is beautiful. I've purchased several of these duvet covers and have been nothing but impressed with the quality! It looks great, washes well (doesn't shrink!), and a great price compared to other brands. Bonus, I have noticed the material gets softer the more times you wash it, so in my opinion, it gets better over time!I haven't been able to find another brand that I like as much, so HIGHLY recommend these duvet covers for all your linen bedding needs!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The color looks great and rich! The size fit our comforter really well too. Highly recommend 👍👍

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: a bit big for my full size comforter but there are some reviews that say it’s for a european comforter. i have an ikea comforter so i thought it was european but i was wrong. my sheets can get veeeery hot which is surprising for linen, but it may be because it doesn’t line up very well with the comforter. it’s really soft and great though i love the color and feel

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It’s a NEED and a WANT
reviews.reviewText: I thought I just wanted it but ended up needing it!!! I did NOT expect linen to be so comfortable!! Huge surprise! It’s everything I wanted and didn’t know I needed :) SATISFIED

reviews.reviewTitle: True colour does not match photos at all
reviews.reviewText: The true colour of this product does not match the product photos. It's not at all what I was expecting. It's much more orange in colour and I will be finding a different product to replace it.
